person.persName: James Crockett Sayers (Kenton County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier)

body.p: Kenton County, Kentucky, laborer, farmer, politician, and soldier. Kenton County native. Son of Henry Sayers and Elizabeth Sayers. Married to Mary C. Sayers. Father of J. Fenley Sayers, Eugene B. Sayers, Charlie W. Sayers, and William H. Sayers. Laborer in Kenton County in 1850. Family owned five enslaved persons in Kenton County in 1850. Farmer in Kenton County in 1860. Owned four enslaved persons in Kenton County in 1860. Served in the 32nd Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a first lieutenant and regimental quartermaster from August 1862 to December 1862. Member of the House of Representatives of the Commonwealth of Kentucky from Kenton County from 1863 to 1865.
